content: This app should be included with every M1 purchase. The Elklink free app is extremely basic and does not provide for multiple users or individual user tracking.  The M1 Touch Pro app on the other hand, is like a window to all of the status and settings of my M1. Things like the ability to view my event list remotely, right down to the user or keypad performing the operation, or the ability to disable a single zone remotely from my phone.  Very cool.  I had a few questions before I first installed the app and a couple minor issues after installation, but the developer was very quick to respond both before and after my purchase.  The support is 5 star by itself.  I was very skeptical before I purchased the app because I had never paid this much for any single app, but after using this for several months I cannot recommend the M1 Touch Pro app highly enough.
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your 5 star feedback!

content: nice and easy to use. just wish it was able to alert you when your alarm goes off
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your 5 star feedback! For push notifications it requires the M1 to send a message to Google's server. Send a email our support email listed on Google Play and I will provide more details.

content:
You guys broke it. Can connect but shows inaccurate armed status. Fail!! 
Even latest 2.2.7 not working. Very disappointing. Ps: working now with 
password. Upgraded to 4 stars for making me put a password in my m1xep, 
which is better than no password. Please do not make changes to this 
expensive, essential app lightly.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. The app required to be updated to meet Google's new requirements, plus to fix a few small bugs. If you rather not get updates then you can turn off automatic updates.

content: A great app. It would be nice to have a fallback IP (as in the IOS version) so that it would automaticall y connect depending on whether the user is on Wifi or Cellular etc. At the moment I have to set up 2 panels, 1 for wifi and one for cellular and manually select the appropriate one. Also the addition of IP video would be great for things like gateway video/intercom systems (rather than having to use several apps just to open a gate).
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your feedback. I am looking at adding an fallback IP, however I have a better solution coming which will not require a fallback IP. Adding CCTV is something I am looking at in the future.

replyContent: Hi, The app supports thermostats, just need to tap on the more button down the bottom right and choose the button 'temps'. If it doesn't display a thermostat then drop us a email and we will help you out.

content: It's quite slow to load up (approx 10 seconds for a fast processor phone, Note 5 and 20 mbps internet upload speed at home and 1000 mbps download speed at work) and it doesn't utilize the fingerprint reader to access the app like other home automation apps such as Chamberlain and Liftmaster's MyQ apps for Android.    The icons that they used in the app such as Chime Off, Keypad, Zones, etc are really low resolution icons and it'd be nice if they appeared sharper (this is just an aesthetic thing but such an easy detail to fix).  It'd be a better interface it was cleaned up a bit more.  For example, I only have 3 keypads so only those three should show up rather all keypads plus 13 unused keypads which will never exist for my home.  The same goes for the other hidden side swiped menus like Function Keys and Change Area.  The bottom tray of icons should be customizable by user.  For example, I don't have any lights on my system so I would prefer that be removed or relegated to the hidden menu and instead replaced by Event Log icon which would be more useful to me.
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your feedback. Are you able to email the support email listed so we can get in contact with you in regards to the 10 seconds to load up issue you are having.

content: Generally works well, but won't register for family library. Otherwise, a five star app.

content: The app does everything it needs to to control my Alarm System.  The support team is excellent, very responsive and even ready to come on line to troubleshoot issues. content: This app is a must have for Elk M1 owners that care anything about security. It is so simple to use, it is basically just an extension of your keypad / LCD readout and allows you to perform most of the basic functions that the keypad does such as setting the multiple arm states, disarm, and function keys. I don't have any of the home automation tasks setup yet, but appears the app allows you to trigger those as well.  The M1XEP, coupled with port forwarding on my router and a DDNS address, it's perfect!
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your 5 star feedback.

content: I have used almost every android app for the Elk M1 over the last 5 years. M1 Touch Pro has been the easiest to connect with, and is literally a virtual keypad on my phone and tablets. It has an solid User Interface, performing smoothly and flawlessly while connected with WiFi onsite, will update once I test it remotely. I truly hope it "sticks around" longer than the prior products. A "Must Have" for all Android-based Elk M1 Owners.  *-Update 12-5-16* - After re-configuring my router,, I set up another connection that allows for remote access to my Elk panel, which works just  as if I was at home... AWESOME!!!
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your 5 star feedback. No need to worry, I am not going anywhere and will standby my app.

That is the only thing I would like to see for changes.

content: Yes works as a live app whilst on the screen, but does not work in a background mode to alert you of alerts or triggered zones. The ekeypad app had this essential function which was absolutely crucial and the point of an alarm monitoring app for Ness M1. If it in fact does have this function please let me know as I'm not the most Tech savvy of people. Cheers
replyContent: Hi, The M1 panel can't actually send push notifications. It's not that the app doesn't support it but it's the M1 that can't send the message to Google's server to notify you. If you send a email to the support email I will provide more details on why this is the case.

content: Great app. Been using for months. But tell me why I can't arm system with app?
replyContent:
Thanks for your 5 Star Feedback!
You need to make sure in ElkRP that the 'access' tick box is not ticked for the user you are arming / disarming with.
More info here: http://www.droidsoft.net/m1-touch-app-cant-arm-or-disarm-m1/
Please email our support email if that doesn't fix the issue.

content: Clean layout. Will like in a future to see this app to integrate with Tasker. Customer service helped in minutes.

content: I'd give it top stars if it would send zone violation notifications
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your feedback. The M1 panel can't actually send Notifications but we are working on a solution which will allow some notifications within the app but this is taking longer than we suspected and we hope to release this soon.

content: This app is worth the money for a DIY'r or installer. However, there should be a free or cheap, scaled back edition for people that just need to arm/disarm the system and to see what zone is tripped.
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your 5 Star Feedback.

content: Great layout. Easy to find the functions. Fast synching over 4g and almost instant feedback of zone status change. Couldn't find an Exit or log out button though. I love it still.
replyContent:
Hi, Thanks for your 5 Star Feedback.
When you press the home button on your phone, the app will disconnect from the M1 (no Logout button required). Soon as you re-open the app again it will connect to the M1 again. The app doesn't need a exit button as it will automatically be closed when the app is not showing on the screen.

content: Good app overall, worked with my Elk M1 Gold. Minor issue getting started: make sure th.e unit name is the same as in ElkRP. sync over cell seemed to take a few tries, but now is working great. Only wish so far is a cancel button on the in-progress connect / login popup, since getting user, port etc. correct can take multiple tries, and timeout with retry can take a while. Glad this one has recent development work!
replyContent: Hi, Thanks for your feedback. Could you please contact the support email listed so we can address the minor issue you had with the unit name as we are not aware of this or know what you mean by this. Syncing over a mobile data connection will be slower as its going over the internet, always recommend to setup the app etc on a Wi-Fi connection first

replyContent: Hi, Thanks for you feedback. We are working on improving the app and will add the option to display items non-alphabetically in a upcoming release soon. (had more people ask to have it alphabetically so that's why it was changed to alphabetically.)
